website_summaries.verdict: The best budget Timex activity watch for anyone looking for an accurate time keeper.
pros: Watch is designed for harsh physical activities such as running, biking, and swimming
Can resist water up to 50 meters for brief periods of time
cons: The wrist band is likely to tear as it ages
Typically lasts only a year or 2 of normal use

customer_reviews.title: Great watch for the money. Really is waterproof.
customer_reviews.text: Wearing it almost nonstop for about 2 weeks. Went in a swimming pool every day with this watch on. The only thing to wear off was the white dots and words around the clock lens. It's recommended to not press buttons underwater, and I imagine the watch will last at least a year or two so long as you don't press buttons underwater, or the watch itself breaks open. It's okay about the fading words because it's only labels for the buttons, which you'll learn quickly. I suggest looking at an online guide or the manual for how to setup chimes and alarms.
customer_reviews.author: Philip M.

customer_reviews.title: Very happy...looks great!
customer_reviews.text: After my old Timex had the band break again, I thought I would rather pay $18 for a replacement than pay to ship it in to Timex for a replacement band. This works great, has a large display, and looks a lot like a more expensive military style watch. The watch does have limited function compared to a Timex Ironman, but since I really need this for time and a stopwatch to time soccer games, it fits the bill. The only knock I have on it (and what appears to be Timex's new style) is that when the band inevitably breaks, you can't just replace it...you have to send it back to Timex, which is a pain.
customer_reviews.author: Leroy Pantsdown

customer_reviews.title: Great Watch, Weak Strap
customer_reviews.text: The watch is digital with an easy to read dial showing time, seconds, day of the week and date. The battery is excellent , and can extend to three years. The one major drawback is the strap, which gets brittle and breaks, generally in less than two years. It is more economical to get a new watch than try to replace the strap, and eventually the battery. I have been wearing this type of Timex watch for eight years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Think about it!
customer_reviews.text: It stopped working after 40 days. I called Timex and they said to send at back at a cost of $7.00 and they would look at it and see if it was the products fault or my fault. They would send it back in 3 weeks or so. The bottom line is that it was not worth it to send it back and have them tell me I somehow damaged the watch.
customer_reviews.author: Parke

customer_reviews.title: REALLY Complicated To Program For Basic Stuff Like Setting The Time
customer_reviews.text: Everything from setting the alarm to setting the time is REALLY counter-intuitive. I'm a fairly technical person. However, after a couple of tries, and finally getting the time correct, I still can't get the day of the week right. I should post a video because it's actually hilarious to watch someone try and do this. You have to hit so many buttons in such a strange order, LOL! I just give up =) If it weren't for the really strange programming instructions this would be a great watch for the price (nice look, good display, band feels good). I really wanted to like this watch but I need a more intuitive device.
customer_reviews.author: Namaste Faustino

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much what you would expect in a low-end watch
customer_reviews.text: I always buy cheap watches, last about 5-10 years, bands go before the watches, and band is irreplaceable, or costs more to replace than buying a new watch. No issue seeing this thing with glasses on. If you are glasses-dependent like I am, real struggle to see numbers without glasses on, and the "night light" is pretty near useless for me. Pretty much what I and I suspect most people would expect from this type of watch in this price range. I'm not surprised by anything -- wanted an "adequate" watch, going for 3* watch, and that's what I received.
customer_reviews.author: RagsToRags

customer_reviews.title: Functional, but light on features.
customer_reviews.text: Large numbers and easy to read. Good light-up feature. Lightweight, so it's good for exercise. But very bare-bones as far as features go. It has a stopwatch but no countdown timer. In stopwatch mode, no simultaneous display of time of day. No setting for daylight savings time. This is OK if you want a cheap but functional watch, but are not looking for much else.
customer_reviews.author: Dagman

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for this price!
customer_reviews.text: Got it this week. I have no complains so far. Update: Haven't take it off. Excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Yanina M.

customer_reviews.title: Simple, Durable Face, Gets the Job Done
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive and with a rugged mechanism, this thing can stand up to getting banged around. Or at least the watch itself can - the band, however, is liable to come apart under a few months of normal wear (happened with two Timex Marathons over the course of six months.
customer_reviews.author: Arty

customer_reviews.title: A Fake Cheap Copy That Did Not Work
customer_reviews.text: The watch received was not a TIMEX watch. The watch received was a cheap copy of the TIMEX watch. The purchase was a rip off. The cost to return the watch will be more than the refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I got good news and bad news.
customer_reviews.text: The good news is that it works fine and the strap is long enough to fit the wrist of a grown man, unlike some such as Casio. The bad news is that it doesn't come with instructions on how to set it. The box refers to the Timex web site for instructions, and that site is awful. After much searching, I found a non-Timex site that had the info.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Cliff

customer_reviews.title: Good watch, but they made the band too flimsy.
customer_reviews.text: I've had two similar Timex watches. I like the watch, its good value for the money. But the band always tears after 18-30 months and it's not worth buying a new band when the watch is so inexpensive. What I don't like is Timex made the band much thinner, guaranteeing it will tear sooner, resulting in my having to buy a new watch sooner. Timex deliberately modified the band to not last as long. This shouldn't be allowed. Or have 2 options, charge a dime more and have a thicker band similar to prior watches.
customer_reviews.author: B. Einhorn

customer_reviews.title: Quality and durability
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this watch. It's my everyday work watch that keeps perfect time and has nice alarm and stop watch feature. It has a large display that's easy to read with a glance. Its light weight and plenty water resistant for my purposes. I've had several of these watches and have never had a problem except that over the course of several years of rugged use the face becomes so scratched up it become more difficult to see the numbers. This is a good looking watch as well. I have a couple of more expensive watches that I like, but I can tell you I will never be without my Timex.
customer_reviews.author: JIM

customer_reviews.title: Total Failure of the Backlight
customer_reviews.text: The backlight stopped working 60 days after I received the watch. In looking for a more expensive, Timex replacement, I found this problem to be consistent on virtually every, Timex digital watch. If not for the failure of the backlight, I would have given this watch five stars. I will not be buying another Timex digital until they get this problem fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would have been nicer if they sent instructions...
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so this one does not set like any other watch; it took me twenty minutes of pushing buttons to figure out how to set this thing. Once there setting was easier, but it would have been better if I had instructions to read first. All that was sent was a big unfoldable sheet of paper that had all the product claims in SEVEN different languages, but nothing on how to operate the watch. Baad mistake! Don't know yet how accurate it is yet, will update in a couple weeks...
customer_reviews.author: Michael W. Black

customer_reviews.title: Cost effective.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several before. They are accurate and low cost. The plastic/rubber bands tend to crack and break like all sport watches. It is basically a dollar or two more than replacing just the band. It is also the same with a battery. Buy the whole watch.
customer_reviews.author: Rodrick L. Riemersma

customer_reviews.title: Watch is OK, but the resin is pathetic
customer_reviews.text: Watch functions ok, used it in extended pool times and continues to function. The strap though is completely useless. After the first year the rubber keeper loop broke. Now, a few months later the main strap broke in an unlikely place. Even worse, its a pain to find a replacement and is much easier to just buy another watch.
customer_reviews.author: Practical Dad

customer_reviews.title: CRAP WATCHES AT AMAZON.
customer_reviews.text: Buttons all stuvk. Cant be set. PIECE OF WORTTHLESS CRAP! :-( grrr! Second piece of crap this montht. Of the five watches I bought from here NONE WORK!!! I learned the hard way. :-(
customer_reviews.author: Roy Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Bought it for the gym
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a watch to wear at the gym to keep time between sets. This watch suits that purpose. It is lightweight. The buttons are self-explanatory - you don't need a manual to figure out how to set it or which button to push. Stopwatch feature is perfect for my needs. I don't use the water resistance so I can't really give it 5 stars in this category. The built in light is fine. Great function and easy of use.
customer_reviews.author: San Antonio Reader

customer_reviews.title: Battery failed but it was comfortable and functional
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: after 2.5 months of use 2 or 3 times a week (at most) the battery failed. My previous Timex lasted ten years. Disappointed -3 stars. Great, for what it is. I needed a watch for the gym just to keep track of rest lengths and duration of exercises. This is great for that. I don't need the alarm and the second clock...yet. The watch strap is soft and comfortable, not too 'sticky'. I've had it four or five weeks and it's working out great. Now if only I could get to the gym.
customer_reviews.author: David Fox

customer_reviews.title: Love the watch, hate the band
customer_reviews.text: I love the face and the digits. Indiglo works great. However, they really cut the corners making the watch band and mine started to crack after about 11 months of regular use. It seemed like a great deal when I bought it, but the band wore out much quicker than competitors. It's no longer a good deal when the band breaks after less than a year. 1/5 - Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: J. Pitt

customer_reviews.title: Better than I thought.
customer_reviews.text: This is a simple but effective watch. Strap is comfy. Watch is solid. The best thing about this watch though is you can read it in direct, bright, sunlight. No problem. I like to keep it simple. Had a smartwatch and a few fitness watches. I have a phone for that other stuff. I need a solid watch that works in rugged conditions. No more gimmicks. This is great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: CT

customer_reviews.title: Band broke, but the watch is excellent value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Worked well, but after a year or so the band broke. A new band would have cost as much as a new watch, so just bought the same watch again. Despite the broken band the watch is recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Peter J. (Hungary)

customer_reviews.title: Great watch.
customer_reviews.text: I love these watches. I need a watch that can tell time, day of the week, and day of the month at a single glance. A Gshock costs over $100 and is huge. This watch does all of that with a timer and stopwatch feature. The only downsides are that the band is not the highest quality. And the battery is more expensive than the watch. I buy this watch once every 2 years when either the battery or band snaps. Not a big deal since these watches cost next to nothing.
customer_reviews.author: EastofWest

customer_reviews.title: Not Messing With a Good Thing
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes it's better not to mess with a good thing. These days, manufacturers seem to be adding gargoyles to your wrist in the attempt to wrest a few more dollars or eyeballs our of a basic product that just needs to work right and not cost much. I don't know how long this exact model has been in production, but something close has been around for seemingly forever. I hope it stays in the catalog for decades longer. It's simple, it's compact, you can read the display (duh!) and the simple controls behave just like you would expect. Not the first one of these I've bought, unlikely to be the last. Nothing goes wrong, but I'm hard on 'em.
customer_reviews.author: Ski Muir Milburn

customer_reviews.title: It tells me what I need
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good basic watch. It tells me the time and date, and has a large display. Also has a stopwatch that is easy to access. The strap is not as comfy as I would like, and the watch is smaller than I thought it would be. But overall it covers the basics, and seems rugged enough as a daily driver. And for a Timex watch, you can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Paolo O

customer_reviews.title: Not a good buy
customer_reviews.text: It's good while it lasts... Had it for 6 months and the band broke for no reason... Yes, it's been worn everyday but that is the purpose of a watch for me.... I thought I could trust the brand but... I had a knock off brand that lasted more than 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Fabs

customer_reviews.title: Great Watch!
customer_reviews.text: I first bought this watch five years ago for my husband. He needed a plain watch for work. For less than $20, this watch stood daily wear and tear for five years. When it was time for a replacement, my husband was pleased to find this watch is still available. Nothing has been changed or "improved." It is great quality at an inexpensive price. This is a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: the__muse

customer_reviews.title: Broken in less than two months of use.
customer_reviews.text: Watch features are good but, this watch band broke within two months of limited use.
customer_reviews.author: Sardonic Jay

customer_reviews.title: Timex no help what so ever.  Have never responded to my e-mails regarding this matter.
customer_reviews.text: Instruction manual is incorrect for this watch. Timex has failed to contact me regarding this and in fact removed the information from their web site. I cannot set the watch and in fact I have been unable to get Timex the respond to my complaints about the incorrect information they had posted other than to remove it. Doesn't do anything to help getting the watch to function correctly. Probably need to return to Amazon since Timex won't respond.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than my old Timex and costs half as much
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace my old Timex that was having problems (different Timex, old one was not this type). Really happy with this one. Half the price of my old one and works just as well after 2 months. I really like the strap. It has an indent on the end of the adjustable strap part that locks the strap-holder in place. This means the strap doesn't come loose from the strap-holder and doesn't require you to adjust the strap-holder back in place multiple times a day. Really cool addition.
customer_reviews.author: onwa

customer_reviews.title: Great mens watch
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband. He prefers simple watches that are easy to use. He is rough on his watches and he just loved this watch when I gave it to him. He uses the stop watch feature a lot. He also went swimming with the watch on and it still works great. I highly recommend this watch.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: It does look like a military watch
customer_reviews.text: Well made. Totally impressed by the quality and ease of use for $17. Yes I would order another when the time comes. It does look like a military watch. Hey if others say in testimonials it can't be submerged or taken in the shower, doing the dishes-don't get it wet! I have had no problems. Like EDC's, I collect watches as well and I'm in my 60's, so I don't want something funky, or out of place, such as huge watch faces. Buy this, you can't go wrong
customer_reviews.author: Kevin McManus

customer_reviews.title: A digital watch that's tough...
customer_reviews.text: I know digital watches are old school but they are still functional for those of us not glued to our phones. I use thsi to remind me to take my medication. This watch is waterproof and pretty darn strong as I wrench on cars and it has taken quite a few heavy hits without issue. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: It's alright
customer_reviews.text: The watch is alright. The band is tiny, like a ladies watch. I compared it to a few at the store and it isn't much bigger than one. The buttons are sensitive. I have yet to find a way to turn off the button press beep.
customer_reviews.author: Random shopper

customer_reviews.title: Affordable wrist watch
customer_reviews.text: Very affordable watch but the watch will outlast the band. Although the watch is very decent at this price with large easy to read numbers, once the band cracks and need to be replaced, you will need to purchase another watch since there are no replacement bands for this style watch.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit for a medium sized wrist
customer_reviews.text: it works perfectly for me. A watch I can afford to get damaged and dirty. Update (1 month later): I noticed the labels have been rubbed off on the outer band. I wore it in salt water one day and after that it started fading. I am changing my rating.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Good watch for the money. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: This Timex...couldn't believe the price but had to try it..is worth more than the price you pay. Feels good on the wrist. Take showers with it on and no worry about ruining it. I haven't used the stop watch yet...The light is bright enough to see the time in the dark but not too bright.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: great watch, Lousy watch band
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the watch and it still works, but the watch band is very poor quality. After a year and a half watch band fell apart and there is no replacement that I could find anywhere, so I guess you just have to buy another watch to get a new watch band!
customer_reviews.author: JWL

customer_reviews.title: Good watch
customer_reviews.text: I like these watches, but mostly I keep buying them because I don't want to learn how to set and use another one.
customer_reviews.author: jimb1972

customer_reviews.title: Good watch!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this watch for 90 days and am happy with its performance. I use the timer and alarm functions daily during runs/workouts and am pleased with how simple and easy it is. The only part that did not last long were the words marking each button function, wore off after the first 30 days. I workout and run outside rain, snow or shine so it doesnt surprise me they rubbed off quickly. There's only 4 buttons so memorizing their function was not an issue. I also liked that it is easily changed to military time.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hill

customer_reviews.title: A Timex?
customer_reviews.text: This may be an OK watch for the price; I'm reserving judgment. But note that the brand name "Timex" appears nowhere on the watch. The enclosed documentation states that a user's manual may be found on the Timex website. But if you go to the website, you will not find a watch called "Marathon." Is this suspicious? I'd say yes, although I'm not sure what to make of it. Like I said, I'm reserving judgment on the quality of the watch, but I'm wondering if it's really a Timex. Why fake a Timex? Why, indeed. But that's what caught my eye and the main reason I made the purchase. After all, those Timex watches "keep on ticking."
customer_reviews.author: B. DelPorto

customer_reviews.title: Number size, and they are big.
customer_reviews.text: The hour numbers are 3/8 inch tall and the date numbers are 3/16 inch tall which is much larger than most. Another great feature is that they only give the day not the month. On many watchs the month indicator makes the day difficult to read.
customer_reviews.author: RosieAndMe

customer_reviews.title: Great watch - good fit, comfortable, simple functions and excellent light.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this watch. I was looking for a simple watch without all the triathlete functions plus I wanted a backlight. This watch is nearly perfect - it is comfortable, low profile, has a great secure strap, and is easy to use. The only issue I have had so far is that the button labels are wearing off; I take good care of the watch and have not abused it, but the printed labels for the button functions are disappearing.
customer_reviews.author: kfcee

customer_reviews.title: Nice everyday watch
customer_reviews.text: Great product and great price. Only negative is the band breaks after a year or so of use. Easier to buy new then replace band only
customer_reviews.author: G. Segura

customer_reviews.title: Good basic watch
customer_reviews.text: Only complaint is that the end of the band slips out of the “keeper” (loop.) I like the large easy to read display, great for old eyes. I don’t use the time and stop watch functions; if you plan to use those a lot get another watch.
customer_reviews.author: David A.

customer_reviews.title: Nice watch, crap strap
customer_reviews.text: Watch was performing perfectly, but the strap broke where it bent to go in the buckle. Just replace the strap? NO CAN DO -- the pins holding the strap aren't accessible as they are on slightly more expensive Ironman watches. Guess I can use it as a desktop stopwatch.
customer_reviews.author: R. Altizer

customer_reviews.title: Piece of garbage!
customer_reviews.text: two months of use and now can't change/ see the correct time after daylight saving. because the set button no longer works. This can't be an actual timex product. of course it lasted past the return period. Amazon should keep an eye on this seller. Must be counterfeit product. Timex wouldn't produce such trash.
customer_reviews.author: Dedicated Soul

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: Only had it a few weeks, but if it performs as well as other Timex sports watches I've owned, I'll be happy. The face looks bigger than I expected, and the band may fail before the watch does, but for less than $20, seems like a pretty good deal.
customer_reviews.author: CMoore

customer_reviews.title: value for the price
customer_reviews.text: I was very unhappy that a manual was NOT included in the packaging to instruct how to use the features and rest the time. Same on you timex. Had to take it to a watch repair place to have them set the time and date, otherwise was happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Roszel

customer_reviews.title: Reliable product
customer_reviews.text: I would buy again. I’ve had this watch for over 2 years and it has done it’s job. I used for marathon training before upgrading to a Garmin to track actual distance & numbers. Good starter watch for any new runner
customer_reviews.author: aggie

customer_reviews.title: TIMEX QUALITY AT IT'S BEST!
customer_reviews.text: Every 4-5 years, my trusty watch will poop out and then I'm on the hunt for a low-level/low-tech dependable, affordable, durable watch. I really simply need big digital digits to see it easily and a backlight, period. This is it! Well-made and not bottom of the line, but not top of the line so I won't cry when it dies.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN

customer_reviews.title: Great watch!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my step son and he lives it! Can’t say much more because all I did was repackage and send it on. It did look great and after he received it he said it was so easy to set up he didn’t even need the directions!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAdventurer

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: The strap broke off not too long after. I would recommend something else if you're active.
customer_reviews.author: 1dad2kids

customer_reviews.title: Pretty rugged but the surface of the watch face can scratch.
customer_reviews.text: A great work watch. The number display is slightly larger than the old style timex marathon model and the watch band has improved. It has a small wedge on the end so the extra watchband slack stays put when you slide it into the loop. I
customer_reviews.author: RAB

customer_reviews.title: The display isn't as legible as some Timex digital watches because the contrast between dark grey background and black digits is
customer_reviews.text: It's a very affordable watch which provides all the functionality I want or need. The display isn't as legible as some Timex digital watches because the contrast between dark grey background and black digits is not so great. I like the large, chunky font. It has 2 time zones, alarm and stopwatch which are all I really need. The "Indiglo" night light works adequately. The design is slimmer than some watches, which I also like, and the controls are logical and easy to use. All round a very good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: R F

customer_reviews.title: A little thick, but keeps time.
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good watch. Of course it keeps time, the numbers are big and clear. The only downside, the thing is thick, 1/2" thick. Otherwise I like it. The shipping and packaging was very good. There is no manual included, you will have to get info from timex.com. That website is not very easy to navigate to find this model.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturing defect limits the value of this watch,
customer_reviews.text: WARNING:THIS WATCH WAS MANUFACURED WITH DEFECTIVE DATE FUNCTION - THE DAY OF THE WEEK IN THE DISPLAY IS INCORRECT. IT DISPLAYS TUESDAY WHEN IT IS MONDAY, WEDNESDAY WHEN IT IS TUESDAY.... I kept the watch as a cheap time piece to wear when working out so I can live with the defect. This item arrived promptly following Amazon Prime shipping policy. The watch fit snugly (I have large wrists) and it was easy to set date & time. Again, this is a budget throwaway watch acceptable only if you can accept an obvious defect.
customer_reviews.author: Alan N.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: This was great watch until it wasn't. Less than a year in and the"mode" button quit working. Sure, it's still under warranty and I can pack it up and send it to Timex, along with $7, for warranty repair/replacement. But I should have never bought it in the first place. You want a Timex sports type watch? Then pony up a few extra dollars and get an Ironman or an Expedition.
customer_reviews.author: Rexter

customer_reviews.title: Pathetic - broken strap in 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: Strap broke 3 months after purchase! Very disappointing from a brand like Timex. ONLY 3 MONTHS!!!
customer_reviews.author: Allyson McCarty

customer_reviews.title: Great watch!  Mediocre watchband.
customer_reviews.text: I love the watch. Unfortunately, the resin band is not very durable and eventually breaks after 1-2 years (in my experience). Once the band breaks, there is no replacement band...
customer_reviews.author: D. Sheffield

customer_reviews.title: Affordable with good functions
customer_reviews.text: Large display, good illumination. Looks nice and affordable. Have not tested water resistance. My third Timex watch, I found Timex watches to be reliable and durable.
customer_reviews.author: RPC

customer_reviews.title: Poor choic
customer_reviews.text: A little hard to set and no instruction. Have to go to internet. Should include instructions
customer_reviews.author: John R Lucy

customer_reviews.title: Modern digital watch with large display
customer_reviews.text: Modern digital watch with large display. I'm liking this watch a lot. I'm farsighted so having the large font display is a huge advantage. It has all the basic features I use regularly. Stopwatch, timer, alarm & 2 time zones. If I lost this watch tomorrow I'd buy another one immediatly.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro

customer_reviews.title: Like the watch, wished the band lasted more than year and a half
customer_reviews.text: Great watch, 2nd one that I have had. First one got at the store, second one I looked it up since I liked the first. The replacement band is $5 cheaper than a new watch but at least it is cheap to begin with. Debating whether to get a third or look for something that will last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Cari Shapiro

customer_reviews.title: Cannot be the Price!!
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for my timex, since you cannot buy a watchband replacement you have to end up buying a whole new watch. Still you cannot beat this price for getting a new watch!!
customer_reviews.author: Serpico

customer_reviews.title: Basic functionality at good price
customer_reviews.text: I give it five stars because it's inexpensive and looks ok. You get what you pay for and maybe a little more with this watch. It's basic functionality and looks ok... Haven't used it much. Put it in a bowl of water and let it stay there all day and it was still working fine afterwards. Hopefully it'll be ok when I go swimming...
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Read and Operate Digital Watch!
customer_reviews.text: Love this watch. Have had a few Casio G-Shock watches and a few other digital watches, and this is just as good as they are. It may not be as fancy but the numbers are easier to read, the date is easy and clear, and the watch is easy to operate! And the price is right! Thank you Timex!
customer_reviews.author: J. Moriguchi

customer_reviews.title: Great Time Display
customer_reviews.text: A watch for my son and he really likes it. Wears it every day. I like the large time display after all that is the purpose of a watch. I have a G-Shock which I also really like but the design jams so much onto the screen the time display is reduced thus making it harder to read the time. Great watch..highly recommend the Marathon by Timex watch.
customer_reviews.author: TB

customer_reviews.title: Great Watch!
customer_reviews.text: 7/16/16 - PRODUCT ARRIVAL Upon receiving the product my first impression was as expected. The watch looks great and had not scratches or dings. It is really easy to use and it fits great. Perfect for Production work to easily check date and time. Plus there is a stopwatch and alarm. Professional Review, Tubbs Media Productions (...)
customer_reviews.author: TubbsMedia

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, price and features
customer_reviews.text: This is the only kind of watch my hubby will wear. Large dial, light for seeing at night. Easy to read and accurate time. Soft comfortable band.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Everett

customer_reviews.title: Big display, good watch.
customer_reviews.text: I've had mostly Casio watches in the past. I went with this one due to the display. Casio makes a big watch with a tiny display. This watch does better than "meets expectations". A solid 4 stars. It's easy to read, easy to program, and has survived several showers. For the price, it's a hard watch to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Stapleton

customer_reviews.title: Fake
customer_reviews.text: I don’t think it’s really a timex, sometimes it’s shows a 24 hour clock or a 12 hour clock apparently depending on what it feels like. Just spend 30 or 40$ for a real timex.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It takes a licking and keeps on ticking
customer_reviews.text: It fits my wrist and tells time. What else needs to be said. I've been replacing my old Timex with a new Timex each time for decades.
customer_reviews.author: R. P. Glass

customer_reviews.title: I like this watch
customer_reviews.text: I like this watch. It was priced right. The problem l had with it is it didn't come with any instructions. So to learn everything about it's uses you have to download the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I just wanted a basic watch that is cool an can do the basic like time an alarm An timer. It does all that. I have this watch for three weeks now an so far I have zero problems with it. It a very good watch An looks nice too I love the design. I do wish it had instructions on how to use it well that's why we have online for that I guess. Overall it's good I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Israel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect durable watch
customer_reviews.text: An amazing watch that will hold up for years. Wont buy another brand of this type of watch. Easy to change batteries too.
customer_reviews.author: Dark Humor

customer_reviews.title: Awesome watch works great
customer_reviews.text: Awesome watch works great. Only reason I gave it 4 stars was because every time I press a button it beeps. If I could just figure how to turn that off I would give it 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Lozano

customer_reviews.title: Band doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: I've bought 3 of these watches. The last two the band lasted only about 8 months and then broke making it unusable.
customer_reviews.author: R. Webb

customer_reviews.title: Other than that I like the bigger display and it feels like it will ...
customer_reviews.text: Wish the back light button was on the same position as the Iron Man Watches and I am not a fan of only 4 buttons but it is a lot cheaper so I guess you get what you pay for. Other than that I like the bigger display and it feels like it will last, I buy Timex watches because I am so hard on watches , I bang them into stuff when I am working one things all the time and I want a watch that will last for more than a couple months.
customer_reviews.author: Chance

customer_reviews.title: I love this watch just what I need nice large numbers ...
customer_reviews.text: Yes,I love this watch just what I need nice large numbers easy to read and night light also,and the wrist band very comfortable,I can recommend it to anyone,and its just priced right
customer_reviews.author: zoltan kopa

customer_reviews.title: Nice watch nice price
customer_reviews.text: We needed a lightweight watch with timer function for high school cross country. This inexpensive option works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: R.K. of VA

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch as a replacement of a Nike watch that I had for years. The wristband broke on that one, and I wanted to buy the same watch again, but it is no longer for sale. I looked around for a long time to find a replacement watch and eventually ended up with this one. Very satisfied with it. Initially had problems finding the settings, but after getting used it no regrets buying this watch.
customer_reviews.author: P. Michel

customer_reviews.title: Good watch, works well in low light with the LED button
customer_reviews.text: Awesome watch. I love Timex brand and this watch works very well. I got it for running outdoors when there is little to no light. The facing is large and the LED button lights up the watch so I can check my run time while on the move. Very good watch.
customer_reviews.author: Brother O

customer_reviews.title: Super decent, great value!
customer_reviews.text: This watch does everything I need it too. 24hr time, timer, stopwatch, 2nd time, and a very good light function. The display is very big and minimalistic, which makes it a perfect watch for me going to Air Force field training this summer. Big display means faster reading, and at $20 it won't break my heart if I lose or break it. My only complaint is that the latch is not beveled very well, and if you wear it too tightly for a long time it will dig and become annoying. Just loosen it a notch though and it's fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Instruction Manual:  Link To Timex Company PDF User Guide
customer_reviews.text: It is exactly what I thought it would be from reading the description and comments - a very utilitarian wrist watch. Thank God for the comments! From reading them, and before I received the watch, I knew it would come without an instruction manual. However, a reviewer mentioned that a person could access instructions online (but did not give the link). Here's the FREE Timex company link so that a new buyer doesn't have to search for it: assets.timex.com/user_guides/Marathon/W292-Marathon-AllLanguages.pdf
customer_reviews.author: R.E.P.

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to set. No instructions with watch.
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to change the mode, time or alarm. No instructions with watch, cannot find model number on Timex website.
customer_reviews.author: Arnsel M. Collier

customer_reviews.title: Great low-priced watch
customer_reviews.text: Broke the strap on my old timex 1440 model. I wanted to replace with the same model but couldn't find it anywhere. Went with this one instead. I love it. This is the watch that I wear when I'm working in the yard or doing something where one of my more expensive watches could get scratched or banged up. But I find that I'm wearing this watch more and more.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would nave been nice to get instructions with the watch to ensure they ...
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if I'll take the trouble to return a $17.00 watch. Did I get a brand new watch or a broken one someone else returned? If I return it, will someone else get a turn with it. I could hit it with a hammer before returning. This one defies being set. None of the instructions I could find on-line worked. When I hit the "set" button, the only thing that comes up is the year, 2015. Would nave been nice to get instructions with the watch to ensure they fit the specific model. First and last time I'll but a watch sight unseen.
customer_reviews.author: Ace

customer_reviews.title: I don't recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Watch okay but band broke after three months haven't worn it since. I think I had for almost a year now. Didn't really care for and didn't want return be because you will be charge a shipping fee. So just kept it in my shirt drawer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great watch very inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: For an inexpensive watch the Marathon surpasses all. Easy to set and use, the numbers are very legible and the indiglo enables night viewing.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Kovac

customer_reviews.title: Dont  waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This was my second Timex Marathon watch. With both watches the band split in half within a few months normal use. The band is worthless. Save your money find something else.
customer_reviews.author: Southshoes

customer_reviews.title: Great watch
customer_reviews.text: This is my 24/7 watch, I beat it and it works Great , the last one the band broke and could not get a replacement so I got a complete new one.
customer_reviews.author: Blam4307

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic for the price and very comparable to the Ironman watch it's replacing for what my needs are.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Jacques

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably nice watch-with a few issues
customer_reviews.text: Nice watch overall-numbers easy to read. Came with no instructions as to how to set the watch. Got the time & date correct on it but day of the week is wrong & trying all the "buttons" on the watch doesn't change it. Not very good for an elderly dementia patient... Price was good. I just expected a little better from Timex.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: My husband had a watch similar to this that was old so I got this as a replacement. It is PERFECT! He absolutely loves it! He never takes it off!
customer_reviews.author: Krista Woodel

customer_reviews.title: so far so good, but i used to get the iron man ...
customer_reviews.text: so far so good, but i used to get the iron man cheaper - a bit nicer looking; though, i would think the inner parts could be the same. timex took the low road here. it's basically the same watch.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Grande

customer_reviews.title: Classic watch that has great features for a low price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch for a giving tree for a teenage boy at church. The quality and look of this watch was impressive and the numbers were easy to read. I know this watch made his Christmas!
customer_reviews.author: Betsy McCollum

customer_reviews.title: It takes a lickin but keeps on tickin
customer_reviews.text: I really like this watch a lot. The numbers are easy to read, light works great. Great value. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: hillbilly boy

customer_reviews.title: Buy this. The display is great
customer_reviews.text: For those who are concerned about the display I recommend you remove the plastic screen protector. Just ordered 2 more, a little more expensive than a new battery but a lot less trouble. The display is fine, Timex Ironman quality. Good enough. Buy this while u can for this price. Outstanding!
customer_reviews.author: Mac Observer

product_meta.title: Marathon by Timex Men's TW5K94800 Digital Full-Size Black Resin Strap Watch
product_meta.description:
If you're looking for a simple digital sports watch, you've found it. A daily alarm, two time zone settings, 24 hour stopwatch, and INDIGLO night-light. Plus it's water resistant to 50 meters.



Timex Group B.V. is one of the best-known American watch companies. Timex's U.S. headquarters are located in Middlebury Connecticut and it has substantial operations in China, the Philippines and India and full scale sales companies in Canada, the UK, France and Mexico.

The company began in 1854 as Waterbury Clock in Connecticut's Naugatuck Valley, known during the nineteenth century as the "Switzerland of America." Sister company Waterbury Watch manufactured the first inexpensive mechanical pocket watch in 1880. During World War I, Waterbury began making wristwatches, which had only just become popular, and in 1933 it made history by creating the first Mickey Mouse clock under license from Walt Disney, with Mickey's hands pointing the time.

During World War II, Waterbury renamed itself U.S. Time Company. In 1950 the company introduced a wristwatch called the Timex. Over the next three decades, Timex was sold through a series of advertisements which emphasized its durability by putting the watch through "torture tests," such as falling over the Grand Coulee Dam or being strapped to the propeller of an outboard motor, with the slogan "It takes a licking and keeps on ticking." With the help of former Olympic broadcaster, spokesman John Cameron Swayze, sales took off. The company later became Timex Corporation, then Timex Group and, to date, has sold over one billion watches.

The company has remained very competitive and the Timex brand continues its dominance through present day. Its primary market remains the United States and Canada, although the Timex brand is sold worldwide due to its ability to capitalize on its strong brand image and reputation for quality.

One of the most successful and important features available on many Timex watches is the Indiglo backlight system. Indiglo is a brand name of Indiglo Corporation, solely owned by Timex for licensing purposes. Timex electroluminescent lamps, branded Indiglo, were introduced in 1992 in the Ironman watch line. They were an immediate success. The Indiglo lamp uniformly lights the surface of the Timex’s watch dials in a manner that makes the dial read very easily in many different light settings. In some newer watches the Indiglo backlight only lights up the numbers, rather than the entire LCD display, which is achieved by means of a specialized film that inverts the LCD transmissivity.

Today, Timex Group products are manufactured in the Far East and in Switzerland often based on technology that continues to be developed in the United States and in Germany. With a large and varied line of watches, Timex has the style for everyone. From the locker room to the board room, there is a great Timex style time-piece for you.



If you're looking for a simple digital sports watch, you've found it. A daily alarm, two time zone settings, 24 hour stopwatch, and INDIGLO night-light. Plus it's water resistant to 50 meters.

See more

feature_bullets: Adjustable black 15mm resin strap fits up to 8-inch wrist circumference
24-hour stopwatch; customizable daily alarm; 2 time zones
24-hour military time mode; optional hourly chime; day & date calendar
Black 43mm resin case with acrylic lens; gray digital display; Indiglo light-up watch dial
Water resistant to 50m (165 ft): In general, suitable for short periods of recreational swimming, but not diving or snorkeling
